meanings.definition: The quality of being easily sold or marketed.
meanings.sent1: The salability of the product made it a popular choice among customers.
meanings.sent2: Real estate agents often consider the salability of a house before listing it on the market.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the salability of his terrible stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: The salability of the new smartphone was through the roof, with people lining up to purchase it.
meanings.sent5: The salability of the antique furniture was evident by how quickly it was purchased at the auction.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of being sold quickly or at a good price.
meanings.sent1: The high salability of the limited edition sneakers led to them being sold out within minutes.
meanings.sent2: When setting the price for the car, the owner considered its salability in the current market.
meanings.sent3: The salability of the rare painting surprised even the art dealer.
meanings.sent4: The salability of the popular toy during the holiday season exceeded all expectations.
meanings.sent5: The salability of the fresh produce at the farmer's market attracted many customers looking for quality products.
